p: Canine circovirus (ssDNA) was first identified in serum samples from six out of 205 dogs in 2012 ( Kapoor et al., 2012a). Subsequently, a similar virus was found in the liver of a dog with severe hemorrhagic gastroenteritis, vasculitis, and granulomatous lymphadenitis ( Li et al., 2013a). Screening with specific molecular assays failed to find a firm association with any disease in dogs, although the virus appeared as a common component of canine virome ( Anderson et al., 2017, Dowgier et al., 2017, Hsu et al., 2016, Gentil et al., 2017). Porcine-like circoviruses have also been identified in dogs in China ( Zhang et al., 2018).
